text.__SUMMARY__: Common names: black asp, black viper.Vipera aspis atra is a venomous viper subspecies endemic to France, Switzerland and Italy.
text.Geographic range: It is found in western Switzerland, northwestern Italy, Spain, and southeastern France. Mallow et al. (2003) describe the range only as "portions of Switzerland".
text.Conservation status: This subspecies is classified as Vulnerable (VU) according to the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species (v3.1, 2001).
text.Taxonomy: A recent study by Ursenbacher et al. (2006) suggests that V. a. atra may not be a valid subspecies.
